entry.title: SDM242 Final Report——Based on SDM202 project
entry.content:
Abstract

After a semester of study, knowledge is gained from courses and projects—in our lecture, what we studied are mainly about concept, function and practical application of op-amp; in our project, what I studied are mainly about MCU、Arduino, focused on motor control.

Introduction

For op-amp, although I did not build an op-amp module from scratch by myself, I have a clear understanding of the most basic principles of op-amp. At the same time, I have studied some integrated op-amp modules and understood the principles. What’s more, because I am in charge of the electronic control part of the project of our group, mainly the control of the motor, so I went to learn the use of MCU and some demo boards, mainly using STM32 and Arduino. In the main text, I will not only talk about knowledge points, I will explain them separately according to the following four points, focusing on the learning process—what I learned、why I learned、how can it do、how I use it.

Op-amp

242, which is represented analog circuit system design, there is no doubt that op-amp is the most important part in 242, so it is necessary to know the most basic principles of op-amp—virtual short and virtual break, all op-amp circuits can be solved using these two concepts. No matter the relationship between output and input can be obtained, the principle of op-amp can be fundamentally understood.

A. virtual short

It means that when the operational amplifier is in the linear state, the two input terminals can be regarded as equipotential—because the amplifier has a large amplification factor and its own output voltage is limited, the differential mode input voltage is less than 1mV, and the two input terminals are approximately The same potential is equivalent to a short circuit. The greater the magnification, the closer to the same. This feature is called virtual short. Obviously, we can’t treat the two input terminals as short circuits.

B. virtual break:

It means that when the operational amplifier is in the linear state, the two input terminals can be regarded as equivalent open circuit—due to the large differential input resistance, the current flowing into the input terminal of the operational amplifier is only 1μA, much smaller than the current of the external circuit at the input terminal. Therefore, the two input terminals can be regarded as open circuits, and the greater the input resistance, the greater the current difference, and the closer to the open circuit. This feature is called virtual break. Obviously, we can’t treat the two input terminals as open circuits.

C. Example

Then there is an example about how to use these two concepts to analyze an op-amp circuit, which is the non-inverting amplifier, below is the analysis:$V_i/V_-$are the two input terminals, using the virtual short: $V_i = V_-$, using the virtual break: the input resistance of the inverting input terminal is very high, and there is almost no current injection or outflow. Therefore, the current through $R_1/R_2$are equal. Set this current as $I$.

According to Ohm’s law: $I = V_{out} / (R1+R2)$, $V_i$ is equal to the partial pressure on $R2$, $V_i = I R_2$, finally get $V_{out} = V_i (R_1+R_2) / R_2$
When studying op-amp circuits, I learned that learning a concept can’t always remember some formulas or terms, but to understand the most fundamental principles, try to use the most basic methods to understand the concept, and go step by step, can’t be content with superficial understanding.

Motor control in the project

Although for the 242, motor control is not the most important part, it can even be said to be the part of digital circuits, but the learning process is very useful, and it is also for the whole group, so after learning I realized that it is meaningful for 242 study.
First of all, at the beginning of the project, I must first determine the control tool to use, or what demo boards to choose—since I wanted to use the robot’s own motor at the beginning, I planned to use the C board(STM32) to develop the control program. Although I need to learn embedded programming, this is also a good learning opportunity, so I started to move forward. I have successfully configured all the programming environment, software and other hardware to be used in accordance with the tutorial and materials, but during the initial practice-the PC cannot recognize the C board and cannot burn the code, which caused the process to stall. I did not find the problem at that time, but when I reused the STM32, I found that it should be caused by an error in the connection line between ST-Link and C board; in fact, there are still several such error correction processes, which made me learn to find more errors in the hardware. At the same time, you should not blindly believe in the tutorials and materials, and make appropriate changes based on the actual situation.
After that, I asked the TAs for help, and finally got a useful piece of information-Arduino can be used to achieve such a modular function. After checking the information, I decided to use Arduino—first, the control program is really simple and effective; second, I wanted to try new things and learn more.
After deciding to use Arduino, I started to think about and find out the specific control method to be implemented—my goal was to implement different control methods, so that I can reserve a few roads in case which control method has problems or does not meet actual requirements. Finally, I found four control methods—one is wired control, the most stable, through PC and serial port control, as a minimum protection scheme; the other three are infrared, WIFI, Bluetooth—infrared has requirements for external conditions and control specifications, WIFI needs to be connected to my mobile phone hotspot and is realized by APP at the same time, resulting in poor stability. Although Bluetooth also needs to use APP, it is generally much more stable than WIFI. In addition to the specific control method, I also implemented two kinds of motor control programs—servo and stepper motor. For these two motors, their control principles are different—the servo is controlled by the PWM signal, and the time when the high level is generated determines the angle, that is the duty cycle; the stepper motor relies on the electrical pulse signal to control the angle and the number of rotations, and cannot be used duty cycle to control. Although I only need to import the related libraries of these two types of motors in the Arduino program to achieve control, the basic principles must be understood. Only in this way can I truly understand the control method and be able to migrate to other development boards’ control.
What’s more, due to changes in our final demo trolley scheme, the specific functions of the motor need to be changed, so the control program needed to be changed—planA only requires the motor to rotate through a specific angle, and does not need to rotate continuously, and the intermediate period is longer; planB requires the motor’s continuous rotation, and can start and stop rotation at any time, the requirements are even higher. Therefore I found that the core code in the library given by Arduino could not achieve the above functions, so I changed the strategy in time—write the core code by myself. I went back to the C’s expression—configure the pins into different output modes: VCC provides power to the driver, pls provides pulses to the stepper motor, dir determines the forward or reverse rotation of the motor, and ena is equivalent to the switch of the stepper motor driver. Finally, I successfully achieved continuous forward and reverse rotation, and the function of stopping at any time. The function implemented by Bluetooth is to transmit several digital signals—1, 0, 2, which represent forward rotation, reverse rotation and stop. In summary, I have implemented many control methods and have the ability to write core codes independently. I have basically mastered the control methods of these two kinds of motors. Although many control programs were not used, I have exercised my programming ability and adaptability, which is very helpful for later learning. And during this period, I constantly searched for information, and constantly debugged—whether it was hardware or software problems, I encountered them many times, but they were all solved successfully. In general, I have a set of debugging procedures, which is very precious for me.

STM32 for servo tester

When I implemented the air pump control of planB, I found the servo tester, which is a very useful control tool, and just found that I can use STM32 to realize a self-made servo tester, which just met my idea of using MCU. So I decided to do it.
The implementation process was actually not complicated—it basically followed the existing steps and then learned from it. So learning STM32 is not only learning programming, but also learning to check information, check data manuals, software use and debugging methods. There are not many parts that really need to be built from scratch, I can just learn from the experience of the predecessors and move over to get what I need.
The specific code will not be explained in detail—in general, the common ADC reading voltage is used as sampling, and then mathematical conversion is performed. At the same time, TIM triggers sampling and outputs PWM signals at regular intervals, which are transferred to the register through DMA and processed Mean filtering, and then output specific values.

Conclusion

All in all, in the process of learning 242, I not only learned the knowledge of analog electronics, but also mastered the methodology of learning related knowledge through practice, and mastered the internal principles, not only in specific scenarios.

If you are interested in some code about Arduino or motor control, you can find all the code in: https://pan.baidu.com/s/1iIlhQWmPiUof1JwQjWSyQQ?pwd=is7i

entry.title: SDM212 Final Report——Based on SDM202 project
entry.content:
As we all know, 212 meas “Design Thinking and Engineering”, and obviously design thinking is the most important in this class. So this final report is to show what I learned from design thinking and how do I apply these to solve the engineering problems for our mobile transportation vehicles project.
First of all, what is “Design Thinking”—Design thinking refers to the cognitive, strategic and practical processes by which design concepts are developed.

For empathize, I think it can refer to ask our teachers requests in our final project. In fact, the final examiner of this project is our teachers, just like our users. Not only to understand the specific requirements of the teachers and their thoughts on this project, but also to exchange some information with the teachers at some times to avoid useless work. For example, Prof.Hong changed my view on the core points of the final project, make me have a clearer direction to go forward——he said that what we have learned in this project and how we use these are more important than build our car. There is no doubt that Prof.Hong is right, we should get something from this project but not just finish it.

For define and ideate, I think Fred-Park is a good tool to finish these two stages. We use functional requirements to define and use design parameters to ideate. At the beginning of this project, we abstracted the requirements of the demo, and subdivided them into small modules, defined for each small part, and then proposed ideas to complete each requirement. There were various ideas, and finally the best way to solve the requirements was obtained by comparison. These two parts are the most discussed in our group, because they are very important foundations in the design and engineering. If these two parts are not organized in the early stage, then there will be big problems later. It is precisely because we understood the importance of these two parts to our project in class, we have been improving the concept in the early stage, instead of rushing to move forward. Specifically, I often turn myself into a car, thinking about how I should move to meet functional needs, how can I complete every action more easily and quickly, so that I can better think about problems from the perspective of a car.

For prototype and test, these two parts are really of great help to physical production, we can simply build a model to verify the rationality and feasibility of the design. Just like what the teacher said: we can’t stay on the nihilistic idea for a long time, we have to make actual things to verify the idea. For example, the robotic arm and linkage mechanism we designed did not seem to have any design problems, but after discussing with the manufacturer, we found that there were major design problems, some of which did not meet the basic principles, and some of the parts could not be processed or the cost is too high for our project. Therefore, we have improved many parts of the design under the suggestion of the processor, and finally have a design plan and drawing that meets the requirements of all aspects. As for the model we made by ourselves not only to verify the idea, but also to find a better way to achieve this requirement. For example, I have tested how to use the suction cup to suck the block, and finally found that the four cubes in the first two rows can be sucked at the same time, and some objects can not be sucked, which both has a great effect on the design of the scheme.

These five stages are not independent of each other——empathize can help define the problem, just like ask teachers about the project; tests can create new ideas for the project and reveal insights that redefine the problem; prototypes can be learned from to spark new ideas. In fact, we have changed our final demo plan, that’s because through prototypes and tests, we founded that planA had some unavoidable problem, so we returned to the stage of defining the specific functions of the car, and finally got planB, which was fit for our requests. In summary, these five parts are interconnected and influenced by each other, forming a complete logic chain and a whole design process.
What’s more, teamwork is a kind of meaningful thing in our project. The entire project must be completed by cooperation within the group. From the perspective of design thinking, it is necessary to divide the work after determining the work to be done. At the same time, cooperation in the process of separate realization is essential. Meanwhile, we should communicate with other groups of students and help each other, this is a win-win situation.

All in all, design thinking is the guiding ideology for our final project. Once there was a design problem, I would return to the entire design process to see which part of the problem occurred, and improve it by communicating with my team members. Although the 212 course is over, design thinking will not disappear, but will be reflected in every subsequent project, providing me with ideological and methodological help.

entry.title: SDM212 Dyson Case Study
entry.content:
5 stages of design thinking process

(1) Empathy
When James Dyson cleaned the house dust himself, he found that the vacuum cleaner would block the hole of the vacuum bag due to the absorption of dust, and the suction power would be greatly reduced, this creates a sense of frustration and empathy with other users to James Dyson.
(2) Define problem
The powder continues to block the tiny holes, resulting in a greatly reduced suction.
(3) Idea
Dyson designed a double cyclone vacuum cleaner. When the airflow moves quickly along a spiral path, all dirt particles will be thrown out of the airflow due to strong centrifugal force. In this way, the dirt can be separated from the air flow without using any type of filter, and the dirt is collected at the bottom of the cylinder.
(4) Prototype
The dust will be replaced in the cone in the middle, then centrifugal force will be used to rotate it to the edge of the tank, and then it will be removed from the tank. This is the first of 5127 prototypes.
Cooling fan (640 prototype products manufactured)
(5) Test
After completing the first generation of products, Dyson conducted market research: For Japanese, their houses are smaller and cleaner, and do not require very large machines; for Americans, they like large machines, so the production cost should be the primary consideration.
They focus on how the machines are assembled together and constantly test materials to achieve the goal of sustainable use of the machines

Types of prototyping methods

(1) Sketching
When designing the steering wheel, the designer directly draws the rough shape on the drawing, and then may change the size or add details on the basis of the drawing. The advantage is that it can be modified without cost, which is more intuitive.
(2) 3D modeling by design software
When considering how the parts are assembled, designers use modeling software to model, simulate the assembly process, play a role in pre-assembly, and verify whether this method is feasible.
(3) Use computer software to make animations to show the general working principles and functions
After the function is designed, a vivid effect can be made through animation demonstration, and check whether it is in line with expectations and whether it can be achieved
(4) Role play
When verifying the flexibility of the steering wheels, Dyson employees dressed up as users walking through narrowing roadblocks to verify whether the flexibility could meet the requirements.
(5) Using cardboard and plastics to make mockup
And when some structures are determined, some simple materials can be used to build these structures to verify whether the relevant functions can be achieved

Why failures are important

As James Dyson said, failure is a good starting point. Because when something fails, so that we know exactly what the problem is, and then know the reason for the failure in the experiment, engineers can use mathematics and scientific principles to analyze and improve, until the final solution is found.
As far as I am concerned, I think failure is the only way to make a product. If there is no failure, it will inevitably be reflected in the final product, and there will be many problems and mistakes that were not there before. Through failure, the correctness of the idea and the feasibility of the design can be tested, and the risk of the final product can be reduced.

Why math and science are important

The foundation of successful engineering design and Dyson’s basic principles is mathematics and science. Most of the work done by engineers includes mathematics and science. Trigonometric functions consider the relationship with other devices.
Use mathematics to calculate the percentage efficiency of dust to adjust the design on the tool to ensure that the maximum efficiency is achieved in the lowest level of mathematics. And science affects all areas of engineering. Both will speed up the process, bring engineers closer to the final result, and learn from it.

What’s the differences of view and approach between James Dyson and scientist? Why does it contribute to innovation?

Scientists tend to think right and it is difficult to think wrong, so they will not do something that seems stupid and wrong, but do something that is beneficial to them; James Dyson thinks he is an artist, he understands invention The value of, will start from another angle, so he will often try some wrong roads, or even completely wrong roads, he thinks this is valuable and meaningful, and will learn things in the process.
James Dyson’s views and methods are obviously beneficial to innovation, because innovation itself means a process from scratch. How many ideas were recognized as wrong or even disgusted at first, but they were finally proved by practice. Innovative products derived from this idea are valuable, so if you dare to take the wrong path and do the wrong thing, you can accelerate the process of innovation. At the same time, the wrong idea itself can also eliminate some mistakes and gain some experience, so that in the final product design process, you can avoid detours and come up with solutions faster.

entry.title: SDM232 Project4——Linkage and cam
entry.content:
Introduction:

This project is to use GGB and Mech Designer to combine linkage and cam, then use Solidworks to produce a 3D model and use Solidworks motion to stimulate the motion.

At the designing stage of our linkage-cam, our group decided to use the knowledge we acquired to design a useful linkage-cam for our final project- the companion robot. We settled on the idea of a mechanical structure that can pour pills into a box in order to make up a prescription.

Procedure:

  • Geogebra

    The pouring linkage-cam requires two main functions. The first function is making the platform which holds the pills incline so that the pills can fall into the box. This is essentially a 2-positon synthesis which can be realized by linkages.

  • Mech Designer:

    The second function is controlling the pouring speed. To ensure the sufficiency of fill-up and pour-down time, we used cams to control the speed of rotation and leave some dwells.

  • Solidworks

    After generating the curve of our cam according to our motion timing requirements, we made a 3D model of tin Solidworks.

    (1) Input the trajectory of the cam which we generated in Mech Designer into Solidworks. (The trajectory transferred into Solidworks is generated according to 1000 points in Mech Designer).

    (2) Draw the 3D model of the cam according to the trajectory we just input.

    (3) Draw the four-bar-linkage according to the statistics (width, length, thickness) in GeoGebra model and Mech Design model.

    (4) Calculate and draw two bars to control the position relation between the driving bar of the linkage and the cam according to the position relation needed. Link two bars with the two edges of the driving bar of the linkage to form a triangle. Because the lengths of 3 sides of triangle are fixed. The position relation between the cam (vertex) and driving bar (opposite side of the vertex) is fixed.

    Detail of the two bars: One bar has a small cylinder hump on one edge which can fit into the trajectory so that the driving bar of the linkage can move along with the rotation of the cam.

    (5) Calculate and draw two bars to control the position relation between the static bar of the linkage and the cam. Link two bars with the two edges of the static bar of the linkage to form a triangle. Because the lengths of 3 sides of triangle are fixed. The center of the cam is now fixed. The cam can only rotate around the center axis of the cam.

    (6) Set the static bar of the four-bar-linkage as the foundation. Assemble the four-bar-linkage first, then fit the cam on the four-bar-linkage using other bars that are used to control the position relation between the cam and the linkage.

    (7) After assembling the pieces to form a linkage-cam model. Add a motion study on the model. Use a rotation motor to drive the cam and observe its motion.

Discussion and Conclusion

In the GeoGebra constructing process, we could not construct the structure following video. The structure we constructed always had more than one driving points. So we turned to others for help, learned a new technique, and solved the problem by adding a new drawing zone.
In MD PRO design process, we rebuilt the four-bar linkages based on the mechanism we designed in GeoGebra. But later when we added a motion controller and the MD PRO automatically generated a 2D cam, we got an odd-shape cam. Different lines overlapped with each other and it hard to make such cam. So we had to rearrange the position of the motion controller and adjust motion timing. Finally, the cam became the irregular circle which can satisfy our needs.

In SOLIDWORKS modeling process, the assembly in the model can move along the path as we designed. But in motion studies, it deviated from the original path and jump to another position.

Speculation: The trajectory transferred into Solidworks is generated according to 1000
points of the trajectory in Mech Design, insufficient statistics results in lack of precision and a failed motion study.

entry.content:
Introduction:

After learning about gears, we consolidated knowledge by disassembling the mechanical alarm clock and analyzing its internal gear structure and its transmission law. After that, we use Mech Designer, SolidWorks, KYtools to further analyze and reconstruct the gear structure, and build a 3D model of the gear system with motion examples.

Procedure:

  • Clock disassembly

    First, we disassembled clock, and drew a simple diagram to display:

    The exploded view of the physical object is as follows:

    There are 12 gears and a special balance wheel in the entire gear train of the alarm clock. Front and reverse gears are interconnected by co-axial rotation.

  • Mating relationship of each gear:

    • Pendulum part

      | | 1(big) | 1(small) | 2 |
      |:———————————- |:——— |:———— |:—- |
      | Teeth number | 18 | 6 | 40 |
      | Engagement relationship | | √ | √ |
      | Transmission ratio | | 3 | 20 |

      Gear No.2 is driven by the clockwork on the common shaft, which in turn drives gear No.1 to rotate. No. 1 gear in the rotation process to drive the common axis of the ratchet rotation, so that the pendulum constantly swing back and forth, strike the bell, and finally make a sound.

    • Second hand part

      Gear No.4 drives the No.3(small), then No.3(big) rotate coaxially with the pinion, while No.3 gear controls the movement of the second hand.
      During the rotation, No.3(big)’s protruding teeth continuously strike the two straight rods at one end of the connecting rod, thus causing it to oscillate. At the same time, the other end of the connecting rod oscillates with the frequency of strikes, and during the oscillation of this end, the straight rod on the No.5 balance is struck by it. During the swing of this end, the straight rod on the balance wheel No.5 is struck by it, and the balance wheel No.5 is thus stressed and keeps swinging.

    • Mainspring part

      |:———————————- | ——— | ———— |:——— | ———— | —- |
      | Teeth number | 40 | 6 | 54 | 9 | 54 |
      | Engagement relationship | | √ | √ | | |
      | Transmission ratio | | 2 | 18 | 1 | 6 |

      Gear No.8 is driven by a co-axial mainspring, which in turn rotates No.7(small)
      No.7(big) and the gear No.10 outside this structure rotate co-axially with the No.7(small), which in turn drives No. 6(small). No.6(big) rotates co-axially with No. 6(small) and eventually drives the No.4(small) outside the structure.

    • Hour hand/minute hand/outside time control part

      | Teeth number | 45 | 12 | 15 | 15 | 48 | 48 |
      | Engagement relationship | √ — | | √ | — | | ** |
      | Transmission ratio | 3 3 | 1 | 1 | 1 | 4 | 4 |

      No.10 gear is rotated by the co-axial drive of the No.7 outside the structure, which drives the No.9(big). No.9(small) rotates co-axially with the No.9(big) and drives No.11 and No.13.
      At the same time, No. 9 also rotates the No. 12. And No.11 controls the time, while No.12 and No.13 control the minute and hour hands, respectively.

  • Analysis

    According to the above analysis, the second hand part is a separate system from the minute hand and hour hand, and the specific system analysis is as follows:

    (1) Second hand

    The mainspring provides power to the No.3 gear through a series of gear meshes, and the actual speed of the second hand is controlled by the hairspring and ratchet. The actual speed of the second hand is controlled by the hairspring and the ratchet. By changing the shape of the hairspring, the speed of the second hand can be controlled.

    (2) Minute hand and hour hand
    The wheel system of the hour and minute hands consists of gears 9, 10, 12 and 13.

  • Mech Designer gear trajectory drawing

    After measuring the radius of several of the gears and obtaining the radius of all gear indexing circles according to the basic law of gear motion, then use the formula: number of gears × modulus ÷ 2 = axis distance, which can obtain the gear modulus.

    Based on the obtained modulus values and tooth values, the gears are drawn and the gear relationships are matched to obtain the final gear trajectory diagram. Finally, export the gear trajectory to DXF file.

  • SolidWorks modeling

    (1) Model the gear part and the shaft column
    Import the DXF file in SW and stretch it as a gear and determine the position of its indexing circle. In addition, to ensure that the initial position meshes without interference, draw the required datum lines on each of the gears to be meshed.
    Finally, a fixed hole is cut in the center of the gear to match the rotation of the cylinder around the axis.
    Create a new column model of the appropriate size to serve as the axis of rotation for the gears.

    (2) Fit the corresponding gears
    Import the gear part in the assembly template and fix its rotation axis in the corresponding position. Use the reference line overlap to make sure that there is no interference in the initial meshing state between the meshing gears. Select the indexing circle of the gear to be mated for the gear fit.
    The motion algorithm verifies that the completed gears rotate normally without interference and rotation mismatch.

  • KYtool use

    This software has the following features compared to Mech Designer:

    • Easy to operate, only basic data such as tooth number and module need to be entered, no additional operation is required

    • Individual gears can be generated for more flexibility, and gear trajectories can be exported directly according to requirements

    • The export process has a feature operation, and it is easier to determine the auxiliary line position in the subsequent operation, instead of just one profile in MD

    • The modulus is an international standard value and cannot be set arbitrarily, which is more in line with the actual operation requirements

entry.title: SDM283 mini project 2
entry.content:
Introduction

In this project, we mainly use the knowledge of material mechanics to design a workbench for placing eight 3D printers(Raise3D E2).

Material related specification constraints

Overall analysis

  1. Intensity

    Therefore, the minimum strength of the supporting structure shall ensure that no obvious deformation will occur when subjected to min Load, which is sufficient for a long time.

  2. Deflection

    The 3D printer has a leveling process before use. If the plane it is placed on is not horizontal, it will cause leveling errors; At the same time, too much inclination of the plane during printing may cause the initial support to slip, resulting in poor print quality or even failure.

    After asking about the specific information of this printer, we got the allowable inclination of 0.1mm, so the maximum deformation of the overall structure is 0.1mm, and the smaller the better.

  3. Weight

    The alloy steel with high strength is selected as the initial material to ensure that it absolutely meets the strength requirements, but the total mass of the structure is indeed too large. Therefore, after the stress analysis, the material will be iterated to minimize the structure.

  4. Size

    Because the placement method is 4 × 2. Therefore, in addition to the length of the printer itself, the middle spacing (considering the simultaneous opening of the doors at both ends for placing printing materials) and the length from the edge should also be considered.

    Because the placement method is 4 × 2. Therefore, in addition to the width of the printer itself, the middle space should also be considered (considering that the top cover is opened at the same time, it is found that the top cover is not more than the width of the bottom as a whole when it is opened to the maximum extent, so no additional increase is required), And the length from the edge (after the design investigation, it is found that the existing design is that the printer exceeds the table edge, which should make the chassis in the printer easy to reposition after being pulled out, so this small design is continued).

    Because the placement method is 4 × 2. Therefore, it is the height of the bottom support plus the height of a printer. But at this time, the overall height needs to be determined according to ergonomics, and then subtract the height of the printer to get the height of the bottom support. According to the average height of men and women, the overall height is within the range of [160, 170]. The height of the printer includes two parts - the height of the printer itself and the increased height of the top cover opening, which is about 98.5cm after measurement. Therefore, the height interval of the bottom support structure is [61.5, 71.5].

Simple analysis for preliminary design

Structural Design

Structure and component design

  1. Bottom support structure

    There are 3 types of column, 2 types of plate and 1 type of beam in this structure.

  2. Outer frame

    There are 2 types of column, 2 types of beam, 1 type of tie rod and 1 type of plane in this structure.

  3. Upper table plate

Connection mode between components

In general, punching and riveting are used at the joints with small stress, while welding is used at the joints with large stress

Material selection

Use the combination of function, constrain, object, free variable of each compoent to decide which material will use.

Bottom support structure Outer frame Upper table plate
Material Metal Metal Wood

Analysis

Load analysis

  1. Upper table plate:

    The load application part is: the contact part between the printer and the desktop (as shown in the figure below):

    The direction of applied load is: vertically downward

    The load on the board is 450N for the contact part of a single printer, with a total load of 3600N

  2. Outer frame

    The load application part is: the contact part between the desktop and the frame

    The direction of applied load is: vertically downward

    The load on the frame is 450N

  3. Bottom support structure

    The load application part is: the contact part between the printer and the board (as shown in the figure below):

    The direction of applied load is: vertically downward

    The load on the board is 450N

Stress analysis

  1. Upper table plate:

    According to the load distribution, the distribution of shear force can be obtained.

    Shear force diagram (V-x image) is as follows (simplified to 2D)—the abscissa is the length of the board (unit: mm), and the ordinate is the shear force (unit: N):

    So for theplate, the stress is full bending, so the stress is:

  2. Long rod in outer frame

    The contact area between the long rod and the plate is all the parts above the long rod, so the vertical stress of the long rod can be considered as evenly distributed, and the stress is:

    In the horizontal direction, the force of long rod is pinned pinned buckling:

  3. Short rod in outer frame

    The contact area between the short rod and the plate is all the parts above the short rod, so the stress in the vertical direction of the short rod can be considered as evenly distributed, and the stress is:

    In the horizontal direction, the force of short rod is pinned pinned buckling:

  4. Bottom support structure

    The stress is pinned buckling, so the maximum stress is:

Deflection Analysis

Bottom support structure Outer frame Upper table plate
Max deflection $3.153*10^{-4}mm$ $1.189mm$ $1.980mm$

Stress concentration analysis

  1. Long pole of frame structure

(1) Part function: support and fix the upper table, and connect the table with the main support structure;

(2) Stress concentration part: the part contacting the lower diagonal rod;

(3) Cause of stress concentration

The rod is rigidly connected with the lower diagonal tie rod, and the contact area of the connecting part is small, the stress is large, and the stress difference between the connecting part and the adjacent section is large, so the stress concentration phenomenon appears.

(4) Improvement measures

Increase the contact area between the lower diagonal tie rod and the member, extend the diagonal tie rod and move its connection with the member to the middle of the member as far as possible to reduce local stress.

  1. Support rod of frame structure

(1) Part function: support the upper table, connect and fix the main body of the frame structure;

(2) Stress concentration part: near the contact with the side diagonal tie rod fastener;

(3) Cause of stress concentration

The rod is rigidly connected with the side diagonal tie rod fixing, and the force acting on the nearby area becomes larger due to the extrusion from the fixing, so the stress concentration phenomenon occurs.

(4) Improvement measures

Increase the cross-sectional area of the member and adopt smooth transition to reduce local stress;

Materials with slightly lower rigidity after surface strengthening (shot peening, rolling, nitriding, etc.) are selected to enhance their fatigue resistance.

  1. Diagonal tie rod of frame structure

(1) Part function: support the upper table, connect and fix the frame structure to make it more stable;

(2) Stress concentration part: near the contact part with the table;

(3) Cause of stress concentration

The contact area between the bar and the table is too small, and the contact position with the table is just the force bearing position of the table, so the force on the bar is also large, which leads to a large stress on this part and a large difference between the stress on its side. The stress concentration is caused.

(4) Improvement measures

Cut off the sharp corner above the diagonal tie rod to avoid contact with the upper table.

  1. Frame structure diagonal tie rod fastener

(1) Part function: connect and fix the frame structure;

(2) Stress concentration part: near the bolt hole;

(3) Cause of stress concentration

Holes are left on the fastener, reducing its cross-sectional area, and the bolt used for fixing in the hole has a large reaction force near its hole due to large force. However, the part of the fastener far from the hole bears less stress, has a large cross-sectional area, and has small stress, so stress concentration occurs.

(4) Improvement measures

A certain thickness of material shall be excavated at the upper and lower sides of the hole to reduce the rigidity of this part, so as to ease the stress concentration.

Failure Analysis

The simulation function of solidworks software is used for static stress analysis to simulate the stress and deformation of the designed table for placing printers under the load of eight RAISE E2 printers.

Without bottom support structure

  1. Load

    According to our design, apply a load of 400N on each groove surface where the printer is placed, and fix the four legs of the table under ideal conditions.

  2. Stress analysis

    It can be seen from the stress simulation results that although the load is directly applied to the wooden plane of the table, the stress on the wooden plane is relatively small because of the large area of load application, and the stress on the wooden plane is almost the smallest in the whole structure, about $8.253*10 ^ 2 Pa.$

    Because the contact area between the frame at the bottom and the wood plane is relatively small, and the weight of the wood plane is added to the load on the frame based on the quality of the printer, the stress on the frame will be much larger than that on the wood plane, and even the part of the whole structure with the largest stress, about $1.847 * 10 ^ 7 Pa.$

  3. Displayment analysis

    In the same static stress analysis example, we can get the deformation of the table under the same fixed and load as the stress analysis:

    Through the simulation results, we can find that the most deformed part of the model is in the center of the wood plane. Because the wood plane only receives the supporting force on its four sides, the center lacks the supporting force applied from the bottom, but because of the placement of the printer, the load applied to the center of the wood plane is relatively large, so the center of the wood plane will have a large deformation, up to 2.31mm. Even at the position where the printer is placed, the deformation reaches 1mm, but the maximum allowable plane deviation of the printer itself is 0.1mm, so the deformation cannot meet the requirements. The reason for this result may be that the elastic modulus of the selected material itself is small, and no bottom support is applied to the center of the wood plane. Therefore, in order to solve this problem, we plan to apply the bottom support in the place where the printer is placed on the wooden plane.

    Similarly, we can also obtain the structural strain image after simulation:

    Because the material we choose to simulate is alloy steel, which has a large elastic modulus, the resulting strain is less than 0.01.

  4. Buckling analysis

    Because when the applied load is too large, the structure may buckle, resulting in some structural failure. Through buckling analysis, find out the position where buckling occurs, and observe the stress change after buckling.

    Fix the four legs of the model without bottom support, apply a load of 100N on the position where the printer is placed, and calculate the load factor at this time through the buckling analysis of solidworks software.

    It can be seen from the simulation results that the load factor is 123.41. In the simulation of solidworks, different levels of grid refinement of the structure will affect the results of the load factor obtained from the buckling analysis, so the results obtained from the simulation will also be biased and may not be correct.

    We multiply the applied load by the load factor as a new load. In the static stress analysis, we can obtain the static stress analysis results of the bottom support structure during buckling by the same fixing method and load application method.

    At this time, it can be seen from the simulation results that the maximum deformation has reached 76.28mm, and the entire structure has undergone visible deformation. At the same time, this deformation is far greater than the printer’s requirement of 0.01mm, which will cause the printer to fail.

Iteration

Material

In order to ensure the stability and strength of the structure in the initial design, alloy steel with large strength and weight was selected as the material of the external frame and bottom support. No specific analysis was carried out for each structure. The data obtained from the previous stress analysis can be used to re select materials to meet the requirements of lightweight

In terms of material selection, we iterated to reduce the mass and ensure that the deformation does not exceed the specified value. By selecting materials with small density and specific modulus within the required range of modulus, lightweight can be carried out.

In the support at the lower end, considering the mass of alloy steel and carbon steel previously selected is large, aluminum alloy is selected by searching for materials with smaller density. The common aluminum alloy material is 1060.4032. 1060 is cheaper, 4032 has higher silicon content, and is better than 1060 in density and modulus. Therefore, 4032 is selected for larger parts and 1060 is selected for smaller parts. Apply them to the four outermost brackets and the eight brackets at the lower end of the printer.

The simulation analysis of the bottom support structure after iterative optimization is shown in the figure:

Its mass is optimized to 14 kg per group.

At the same time, common desktop materials are searched, which are often used as particleboard and medium density fiberboard. Its modulus and density are similar to that of light wood. We also tried to apply it to marble, but we measured that the mass of the table top when applying marble was 426 kg, which was far beyond our expectations for mass, so we rejected it.

The simulation results of the overall desktop are shown in the figure:

Its mass is optimized to 80 kg.

Structure

  1. Bottom support structure

    From the stress diagram, it is obvious that the stress of the four column2(blue) parts is smaller than that of the rest parts, so it is considered that holes can be dug to reduce the weight without damaging their main functions.

    After iteration:

  2. Tie rod 1 in outer frame

    From the stress diagram, it is obvious that the stress of the two tie rod1(blue)s is smaller than that of the rest. Therefore, it is considered that holes can be dug to reduce the weight without damaging their main functions.

    After iteration:

  3. Column4 in outer frame

    From the stress diagram, it can be seen that there is stress concentration at the contact part between column4 and the table board. The reason is that the contact area is too small, which mainly results in the stress at the top, causing sudden changes and concentration of stress. Therefore, it is necessary to increase the contact area to reduce the stress.

    After iteration:

Analysis after iteration

  1. Load analysis

    Basically, the load size and direction on all structures have not changed, but the change of materials and specific structures has led to a slight change in the stress. At the same time, the deformation size has changed, and the stress concentration has decreased.

  2. Stress analysis

    For outer frame and table plate, the overall distribution is more uniform, and the maximum value is decreased from $1.847 × 10^7$ to $1.614 × 10^7$, the minimum value is increased from $8.253 × 10^2$ to $1.283 × 10^3$.

    For bottom support structure, the overall distribution is more uniform, and the maximum value is decreased from $2.652 × 10^5$to $2.103 × 10^5$, the minimum value is increased from $3.094 × 10^2$ to $4.505× 10^2$.

    In general, the overall change of stress is small, and the structure can still meet the strength requirements.

  3. Strain analysis

    For outer frame and table plate, except for the minimum deformation, other deformation increases to a small extent, but the basic deformation of the external frame is 0.001 mm, which meets the requirements. As for the large deformation in the middle of the upper table, the deformation will be greatly reduced after the installation of the bottom support structure.

    For bottom support structure, except for the minimum deformation, the other deformation is basically 3 times of the previous deformation, but the basic deformation is far less than 0.01 mm, meeting the requirements; Even if it is loaded with one more serving board (with a small mass), it will not change too much.

  4. Buckling analysis

    For outer frame and table plate, the overall amplitude increases slightly, and the load factor decreases significantly from 123.41 to 58.159, that is, the maximum load decreases significantly, which makes it easier to fail.

    For bottom support structure, the overall amplitude increased slightly, and the load factor decreased significantly from 6672.2 to 1603.9, that is, the maximum load decreased significantly, making it easier to fail.

Conclusion

After secondary design, a relatively satisfactory supporting structure is finally obtained, which is divided into three parts: the upper table board, the outer frame, and the bottom supporting structure(× 8).

entry.title: SDM283 mini project 3
entry.content:
Introduction

In this project, based on a four wheel racing model, we use Adams to simulate its traveling state on bumpy roads, and change its own shock absorber to achieve the minimum vibration and deflection of the front beam.

Simple Research on Automobile Shock Absorber

Definition and basic functions

The shock absorber is one of the important components in the vehicle suspension system, which has an important impact on the vehicle driving safety and comfort.

There are two basic functions - correcting the transmission from uneven road surface to vehicle by adjusting vehicle body vibration; Quickly attenuate the wheel and axle vibration caused by road impact to provide a safe grip for the vehicle.

Suspension parameters

The main parameters related to the shock absorber are stiffness and damping coefficient, which have a great impact on the vehicle’s ride comfort. A reasonable matching of stiffness and damping coefficient can reduce the transfer function and improve the vehicle’s ride comfort - that is, reduce the free deflection at the end of the beam.

Damping coefficient

When the stiffness of the front and rear shock absorbers changes, the root mean square value of the total weighted acceleration at the seat changes, and the front damping change has less impact on the vehicle ride comfort than the rear damping. The higher the damping force, the more sporty the car is; the lower the damping force, the better the car’s comfort (definition: low speed level of vibration occurring on the whole vehicle and vehicle parts).

It can be seen from the figure that the amplification coefficient of body acceleration increases with the increase of damping constant in the frequency range between body and wheel resonance frequencies, and the comfort of the vehicle becomes worse.

There are three important characteristic curves in the research of shock absorber: damping force displacement curve, quasi-static and dynamic damping force velocity curve

The damping coefficient and attenuation coefficient describe the trend of the quasi-static damping force velocity characteristic curve. The damping coefficient affects the slope of the curve, while the attenuation index affects the concave convex trend of the curve.

Dynamic damping shows the relationship between damping force and piston speed at a certain excitation frequency - the overall trend is to decrease with the increase of excitation frequency.

Stiffness

When the front and rear spring stiffness changes, the root mean square value of the total weighted acceleration at the seat has a significant change, and the change of the front spring stiffness has less impact on the vehicle ride comfort than the change of the rear spring stiffness.

Adams stimulation

Overview of simulation model

Physical definition of beam

There are two types of physical definition of beam: rigid and flexible beam.

For rigid beam, we need to add a fix joint-between the beam and the beam holder:

For flexible beam, we need to use flex function in Adams to construct it:

More information about rigid and flexible in stimulation software:

Most simulation analysis uses rigid components, which will not deform under the force. In reality, it can meet the requirements to treat most components as rigid bodies, because the elastic deformation between parts has little impact on the dynamic characteristics of each part of the mechanism.

However, it is necessary to consider the deformation of components, which will affect the accuracy results. When it is necessary to study the size and distribution of stress and load output of components, as well as thin-walled components and high-precision instrument components, they should be treated as flexible bodies, so that the calculation results will be more accurate. Establishment of mathematical model of damping system

    Through the analysis of the image, it can be concluded that the damping system of the trolley is based on the natural frequency $ω_n$ to control, the value of $ω_n$ becomes larger, the more compressed the functions $h (t)$ and $s (t)$ as t in time, and the higher the oscillation frequency, so that the rise time of the system. If the natural frequency is low, the damping system tends to filter out slower changes, so as to provide a stable driving environment, but this will increase the rise time of the system, and the system will become sluggish.

    As the damping coefficient decreases, the cut-off curve of the system frequency response becomes steeper, and overshoot and oscillation tend to increase, which means that a compromise is found between the starting point and the frequency domain, that is, the system frequency and $ξ$ Is related to the value of. However, k is too large, the natural frequency is high, and the filtering in the damping system area changes rapidly, which leads to unstable driving of the car. Then the elastic coefficient can be a compromise value.

Abstract

This experiment examined the first order inverted pendulum, we obtain the numerical linearized transfer function model of the inverted, build the nonlinear system in simulink, and carry out a closed-loop simulation with the controller we designed.
Inverted pendulum control system (IPS) is a complex, unstable and nonlinear system, which is an ideal experimental platform for teaching control theory and conducting various control experiments. The typicality of inverted pendulum is that, as a controlled object, it is a high-order, unstable, multi-variable, nonlinear and strongly coupled complex controlled system, which can effectively reflect many problems in the control.
The research of inverted pendulum system can effectively reflect many typical problems in control, such as nonlinear problem, robustness problem, stabilization problem, follow-up problem and tracking problem. The control of inverted pendulum is used to test whether the new control method has strong ability to deal with nonlinear and unstable problems.

Introduction

The purpose of this experiment was to make inverted pendulum stable without upswing. These were be done by using linear transition, pole assignment and matlab simulink. We use our own simulink to simulate the control, and use the provided simulink to control the actual inverted pendulum, and compare the two results, get the differences, and then analyze the reasons, and expect to learn the stable control method for the inverted pendulum system through the above process.

entry.content:
该文档包含了在学习SDM375智能机器人设计这门课程中的作业记录

Week1

Theory Class

一、机器人四大家族

（1）产品特点

类型 特点
KUKA 对本体结构和易用性的创新，系统集成业务占比最高，并且操作简单——“最为炫酷，爱好黑科技”
FANUC 在于高精度、重量轻和小型化等特点，而且存在负载能力较弱的缺点，基本负载达到80%就会报警——“技艺精湛，整合能力极强”
YASKAWA 在于稳定性好，负载大，满负载运行也不会报警，但是精度较差；综合售价最低——“简洁实用，性价比高”
ABB 在于对运动控制和自动化的整合，其机器人的整体性较优——“极度严谨，实用至上”

（2）核心指标

类型 特点
KUKA 操作简单（其实存在一定的落后）
FANUC 数控系统稳定易用、性价比高、覆盖面广，同时有着整套的加工和生产流水线
YASKAWA 伺服电机系统（AC 伺服）
ABB 运动控制系统，其算法是最好的，不仅仅有全面的运动控制解决方案，产品使用技术文档也相当专业和具体
二、分析原因

（1）协作机器人公司Rethink Robotics破产的原因
Rethink于2008年成立，是业内最先提出协作机器人概念的公司。如图1所示，在过去的10年时间里，Rethink主要发布了两款机器人Baxter (2012年)和Sawyer (2015年)。
Rethink是工业协作机器人这个门类的开创者，但是最终却走上了破产的道路，以下是原因：Rethink的核心问题是没能将其产品与其他产品的不同转化成使用者能够实际感受到的益处，出在技术到产品定义和使用场景的转化上——Rethink一开始的技术路线就过于激进，与传统机器人的形态、结构和追求的指标都相差甚远，也并没有想好真实的使用场景。而且其具备的技术方式，已经离工业客户的需求有较大距离，比如：Baxter在机器人关节中内置了弹性元件SEA，而这让机器人整体的刚度和精度变得非常低，比传统机器人低2个数量级，这在精细化操作上是不能被接受的。
以上这些都直接导致了其机器人产品的销售量远远低于预期，导致现金流不足，最终导致公司破产。

（2）机器人新秀UR (Universal Robotics）公司成功的原因
Universal Robots公司(优傲机器人)是一家致力于开发具有广泛可用性的机器人技术的公司，公司成立于2005年，总部位于丹麦的欧登塞市。UR机器人可以在所有工业生产领域实现自动化和合理化，具备成本效益高、高度灵活、且使用方便安全等特点，广获业界青睐。Universal Robots (优傲机器人)的核心产品是6轴串联工业机器人。
以下是UR公司成功的原因：优傲机器人具有更先进的设计理念——首先是协作的理念，机器人与人共享工作空间，共同完成某项工作；其次是安全的理念，有专利保护的安全参数设置方式，保护人和机器人不受伤害；再次是人性化的理念，图形化界面以及简单编程和操作，任何人都可以成为机器人工程师；还有实用的理念，快速灵活部署，省时省电省维护；最后是经济的理念，投资回报快，适应中小企业多品种生产，提高竞争力。这些使得它的产品在质量和成本上面有着优势，在市场上更受欢迎；同时UR开发了全免费在线学习系统“优傲学院”，可以随时随地学习UR机器人技术知识，这也让更多的人能够了解UR，受众更多，市场被无意中扩大。

三、SpotMini调研报告

SpotMini由Boston Dynamics研发，2016年正式亮相实机。总的来说SpotMini是一款小型的四足机器人，重量为约25kg（带上手臂30kg），它是电池能源供电，液压系统作为驱动设备，所以免去了油料燃烧产生的噪声，因此运动起来相对比较安静；同时充电一次可以使用约90分钟，而且可以实现室内和室外的操作。
SpotMini本身的传感器包括：3D距离传感器、惯性测量单元、以及四肢内的位置/力量传感器。这些都是感知周围环境、了解自己运动状态，从而实现自主导航的必备传感器：SpotMini的正面，侧面，后面都安装了视觉传感器，拥有360°的导航视野。SpotMini使用的3D距离传感器同样来自这家公司，型号为MultiSense S7 ，是一种紧凑的双目立体相机，分辨率高达2K x 2K，通过两相机视差可以计算出物体和相机的距离。这些立体摄像头可以帮助机器狗组装3D点云，机器狗的四个侧面至少有4个摄像头，前面还有8个巨大的摄像头，使得它的能见度在没有机载激光雷达的情况下达到4米。
操控Spot的方法是使用附带的7英寸Android平板电脑，它看起来像是任天堂和Xbox控制器的混合体，并且显示器的左右两侧装有一整套手柄控制装置。机器狗可以通过平板上的两个操纵杆来控制，左边的操纵杆用来上下左右，右边的控制旋转。不仅如此，你还可以发出高级指令，它的每条腿可以自动躲避障碍。你还可以在周围设定一些位置来进行自主行进，并且可以记录和播放行进路线。
机器人实现自主定位和导航的核心技术称为Simultaneous Localization and Mapping，简称SLAM，中文译作同时定位与地图创建。而SpotMini由于事先人工引导建立了地图，解决了未知环境的问题，所以难度比SLAM降低了不少。因此，可以说SpotMini的自主导航其实是在已经建立好的地图上进行的定位，可以认为是利用3D视觉传感器及IMU来观察周围环境，看看自己在地图的什么位置，然后开始规划自己的运动路径，沿着地图奔跑。
而目前SpotMini的应用领域包括以下部分：
（1）娱乐： SpotMini可以发挥娱乐机器人作用，与人们进行互动
（2）应急响应： SpotMini 已经可以灵活运动，也许未来 SpotMini 还可以与其他机器人（比如无人机、机器蛇等）组队执行搜索和救援任务。当然它还需要克服高温、潮湿和肮脏环境等。
（3）包裹配送：对于一般的包裹递送，快递员是最便宜和高效的方案。不过机器人的优势在递送食品。由于食品订单是间歇性和不可预测的，配送员经常需要等待。对于机器人来说，等待的时间成本很低。而且他们还能向饥肠辘辘的客户准确预测送达时间，甚至愿意亲自送到客户身边
（4）工程建设：建筑工地当然算是有着许多复杂物体的危险环境了。地面的情况也在不断变化，要求机器人有很好的运动能力。SpotMini 可以在两点之间搬运重物，不过实现自动搬运算法花费的成本就要额外计算了
综上所述，SpotMini是目前的一款比较先进的机器人，且已经被投放入市场，广受消费者喜爱。

Week2

Theory Class

一、对比ROS和工业机器人操作系统的优缺点

ROS

（1）优点

ROS的设计者考虑到各开发者使用的开发语言不同，因此ROS的开发语言独立。因此，除了官方提供的功能包之外，ROS还聚合了全世界开发者实现的大量开源功能包，这些开源功能包与 ROS一起构成了强大的开源生态环境
ROS的系统结构设计也颇有特色，ROS运行时是由多个松耦合的进程组成，每个进程ROS称之为节点(Node)，所有节点可以运行在一个处理器上，也可以分布式运行在多个处理器上。在实际使用时，这种松耦合的结构设计可以让开发者根据机器人所需功能灵活添加各个功能模块

（2）缺点

ROS因为将功能分布在各个节点之中，节点间基于消息机制通信，通讯部分消耗了很多系统资源。尤其是当所有节点位于同一个处理器时，ROS仍然一直执行相应的消息分发，节点间的数据传递通过内存复制，大量的系统资源都浪费在通讯上，使得系统必须选用高性能的处理器和存储系统以弥补损耗。换句话说，利用ROS来实现SLAM，需要配备性能优越的硬件设备，这对于一些小型化嵌入式平台，尤其是实际的机器人产品里，其对计算资源、存储空间的消耗会使成本大幅上升
除了ROS本身系统设计的局限性外，利用ROS实现SLAM需要深入的调整优化，耗费大量人力与时间成本。更为重要的是，针对具体的机器人产品，如扫地机器人，还需要独特的贴边清扫、折回清扫、多房间自主导航等功能，目前已有的ROS系统，只能实现简单的建图，无法满足扫地机器人的实际需要
缺乏构建多机器人系统的标准方法
在Windows、MacOS、RTOS等系统上无法应用或者功能有限
缺少实时性方面的设计（在ROS 2上有所改进）
需要良好的网络环境保证数据的完整性，而且网络没有数据加密、安全防护等功能；
ROS 1的稳定性欠佳，研究开发与上市产品之间的过渡艰难

工业机器人操作系统

（1）优点
具有较高的重复定位精度，系统刚性好
采用开放式软件、硬件结构，可以根据需要移植到不同的系统
功能的模块化设计，不同的任务有不同的功能模块实现
满足实时性、多任务的要求
具备网络通讯功能，以便于多台机器人协同工作
直观便捷的人机交互
（2）缺点
不同工业机器人的开发系统基本都不一样，示教、编程方法也不同，一个熟练使用Motoman的工程师很可能并不会使用Kuka机械臂。就算是同种机器人，由于固件版本的更新换代，也可能造成程序的不兼容

总结：
对比来说，ROS较之工业机器人操作系统来说最大的优势是其分布式操作系统，更具有可操作性；而工业机器人操作系统较之ROS较之来说最大的优势是实时性高，且系统不易损坏。

二、ROS未在工业领域广泛应用的原因

ROS已广泛应用于Clearpath物流机器人、Fetch导购机器人、Erle无人机、DJI大疆无人机、DataSpeed自动驾驶汽车、Nao舞蹈机器人、Lego玩具机器人、iRobot扫地机器人、Pepper情感机器人等，但工业机器人领域的应用却寥寥无几，原因如下：
（1）系统太过庞大、太过冗余
一方面是因为ROS系统内置的功能包太多，但其实企业在运用的过程中用不上这么多的功能包；另一方面是因为ROS系统内置的功能包会依赖于很多第三方的库和软件包，且依赖关系太过复杂，这是ROS系统不争的劣势
（2）ROS系统的实时性差
用ROS系统，发布指令之后，机器人可能要延迟一段时间才会执行，有些时候是不能满足工业需求的；ROS系统的实时性是不够的，还是必须搭配单独的运动控制器

三、对比Linux系统和Windows系统的不同之处
（1）大小写
linux区分大小写，windows在dos界面命令下不区分大小写
（2）文件系统区别
在 windows 下，打开 “计算机”，看到的是一个个的驱动器盘符，每个驱动器都有自己的根目录结构，这样形成了多个树并列的情形；在 Linux 下，看不到这些驱动器盘符，看到的是文件夹（目录）：linux没有盘符这个概念，只有一个根目录 /，所有文件都在它下面
（3）文件形式
linux所有内容均以文件形式保存包括硬件，用户，而windows文件和硬件没什么关系，两个之间没有关联
（4）扩展名
windows用扩展名区分文件如.exe代表执行文件，.txt代表文本文件，而linux无扩展名的概念，当然为了管理员区分方便会有部分扩展
（5）平台本身区别
windows平台:数量和质量的优势，不过大部分为收费软件；由微软官方提供重要支持和服务
linux平台：大都为开源自由软件，用户可以修改定制和再发布，由于基本免费没有资金支持，部分软件质量和体验欠缺；有全球所有的Linux开发者和自由软件社区提供支持
（6）安全性
windows下的.exe文件不能直接在linux下安装与运行，同时linux大部分是字符界面，大大增加了linux系统的安全性，减少了木马攻击的可能性
（7）占用资源
同时linux字符界面占用的系统资源要小于windows下的图形界面所占的资源
（8）交互方式
Windows系统用户可以直接打开软件进行图形界面的操作，而linux系统用户需要通过命令行来执行
总的来说，Linux系统使用命令行界面，执行率较高、系统资源占用率较少，更加适合服务器; Windows系统使用图形化交互界面，更适合人机交互、广泛应用于个人电脑。

一、对比ROS 中topic 、message 、service 的关系与区别

（1）关系

topic和service是两种不同的通信方式，存在各自的优势与缺点，而message就是topic内容的数据类型，也称之为topic的格式标准

二、系统的梳理ROS 文件空间的结构，并说明每部分的作用

与其他操作系统相似，一个ROS程序的不同组件要被放在不同的文件夹下，这些文件夹是根据不同的功能来对文件进行组织的。
首先是Catkin工作空间，即创建、修改、编译catkin软件包的目录。Catkin的工作空间，直观的形容就是一个仓库，里面装载着ROS的各种项目工程，便于系统组织管理调用。在可视化图形界面里是一个文件夹，ROS代码通常就放在工作空间中——该工作空间下会有3个文件夹：src、build、devel：
（1）src源文件空间：这个文件夹放置各个功能包和一个用于这些功能包的CMake配置文件CMakeLists.txt——由于ROS中的源码采用catkin工具进行编译，而catkin工具又是基于cmake技术的，所以会在src源文件空间和各个功能包中都会见到一个文件CMakeLists.txt，这个文件就是起编译配置的作用
（2）build编译空间：这个文件夹放置CMake和catkin编译功能包时产生的缓存、配置、中间文件等
（3）devel开发空间：这个文件夹放置编译好的可执行程序，这些可执行程序是不需要安装就能直接运行的。一旦功能包源码编译和测试通过后，可以将这些编译好的可执行文件直接导出与其他开发人员分享

Theory Class

一、通信方式是ROS的核心功能，描述其包含的四种通信方式

包括topic、service、parameter service、action

(1) Topic

对于实时性、周期性的消息，使用topic来传输是最佳的选择。topic是一种点对点的单向通信方式，这里的“点”指的是node，也就是说node之间可以通过topic方式来传递信息

(2) Service

Service通信是双向的，它不仅可以发送消息，同时还会有反馈。所以service包括两部分，一部分是请求方（Clinet），另一部分是应答方/服务提供方（Server）。这时请求方（Client）就会发送一个request，要等待server处理，反馈回一个reply，这样通过类似“请求-应答”的机制完成整个服务通信

(3) Parameter service

与前两种通信方式不同，parameter service也可以说是特殊的“通信方式”。特殊点在于参数服务器是节点存储参数的地方、用于配置参数，全局共享参数。参数服务器使用互联网传输，在节点管理器中运行，实现整个通信过程。它更加的静态，参数服务器维护着一个数据字典，字典里存储着各种参数和配置

(4) Action Action

类似service，算是service的升级版本，是带有状态反馈的通信方式，通常用于长时间、可抢占的任务中。其主要弥补了service通信的一个不足，就是当机器人执行一个长时间的任务时，假如利用service通信方式，那么publisher会很长时间接受不到反馈的reply，致使通信受阻。当service通信不能很好的完成任务时候，action则可以比较适合实现长时间的通信过程。Action通信过程可以随时被查看过程进度，也可以终止请求，这样的一个特性，使得它在一些特别的机制中拥有很高的效率

(1) Node 和 topic
首先，publisher节点和subscriber节点都要到节点管理器进行注册，然后publisher会发布topic，subscriber在master的指挥下会订阅该topic，从而建立起sub-pub之间的通信，整个过程是单向的；且一个topic可以有多个publisher和subscriber

(2) Node 和 service
Node B是server（应答方），提供了一个服务的接口，叫做/Service，一般都会用string类型来指定service的名称，类似于topic。Node A向Node B发起了请求，经过处理后得到了反馈

(3) Node 和 action
基本和service过程相同，action的工作原理是client-server模式，也是一个双向的通信模式。通信双方在ROS Action Protocol下通过消息进行数据的交流通信。client和server为用户提供一个简单的API来请求目标（在客户端）或通过函数调用和回调来执行目标（在服务器端）

(4) Node 和parameter service
Parameter Server的作用相当于全局变量之于程序，各个Node可能不一定位于同一个PC中，但是只要在同一个ros环境里，都可以通过Parameter Server来访问全局字典的参数

一、摄像头标定的意义

一、SLAM与移动机器人

SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping), 即时定位与地图构建，或并发建图与定位。问题可以描述为：机器人在未知环境中从一个未知位置开始移动，在移动过程中根据位置估计和传感器数据进行自身定位，同时建造增量式地图。在SLAM中，机器人利用自身携带的传感器识别未知环境中的特征标志，然后根据机器人与特征标志之间的相对位置和里程计的读数估计机器人和特征标志的全局坐标。
总体框架如下：

SLAM技术主要是解决机器人的地图构建与即时定位，而并没有实现路径规划和运动控制。也就是说为机器人的自主移动提供了前提，使得机器人对所处环境有了认知，并且建立了自己与环境的坐标关系，之后就可以增加自主控制的部分，实现智能自主移动机器人的建立。

二、ROS中SLAM功能包对比

(1) Gmapping
Gmapping 算法是目前基于 激光雷达和 里程计方案里面比较可靠和成熟的一个
算法，它基于粒子滤波，采用RBPF的方法效果稳定，许多基于ROS的机器人都跑的是gmapping_slam。
优点：在长廊及低特征场景中计算量较小、精度较高、建图效果好
缺点：严重依赖里程计（odometry）；无法适应无人机及地面不平坦的区域；无回环（激光SLAM很难做回环检测）；不适合大场景（因为粒子增加，而每个粒子都携带一张地图，因此在构建大地图是所需内存和计算量都会增加），特别消耗资源
(2) Hector_slam
Hector_slam算法是利用高斯牛顿方法解决scan-matching问题，只需要激光雷达数据， 而不需要里程计数据。
优点：不需要使用里程计，所以使得空中无人机及地面小车在不平坦区域建图存在运用的可行性；利用已经获得的地图对激光束点阵进行优化；可避免局部最小而非全局最优，使用多分辨率地图
缺点：需要雷达（LRS）的更新频率较高（40Hz）、测量噪声小；需要robot速度控制在比较低的情况下，建图效果才会比较理想；且在里程计数据比较精确的时候，无法有效利用里程计信息
总体来说，Hector_slam算法的效果不如 Gmapping，因为它仅用到激光雷达信息建图与定位，肯定就不如Gmapping是通过多传感器结合的效果好。
(3) Cartographer
Cartographer算法是是Google的实时室内建图项目，传感器安装在背包上面，可以生成分辨率为5cm的2D格网地图。获得的每一帧laser scan数据，利用scan match在最佳估计位置处插入子图（submap）中，且scan matching只跟当前submap有关。在生成一个submap后，会进行一次局部的回环（loop close），利用分支定位和预先计算的网格，所有submap完成后，会进行全局的回环。
优点：不采用粒子滤波（PF），累计误差较前两种算法低，能天然的输出协方差矩阵，后端优化的输入项，从而低廉设备也能获得较好的性能表现
缺点：需要复杂的矩阵运算，因此计算量大
总体来说，cartographer算法相比gmapping，前者是基于图优化框架的SLAM，后者基于滤波框架的SLAM，因此随着地图构建的扩大，内存消耗和计算量都很大，但是建图的效果相当好
(4) ORB_SLAM
ORB_SLAM算法是是西班牙 Zaragoza 大学的 Raúl Mur-Arta 编写的视觉 SLAM 系统。 它是一个完整的 SLAM 系统，包括视觉里程计、跟踪、回环检测，是一种完全基于稀疏特征点的单目 SLAM 系统，同时还有单目、双目、RGBD 相机的接口。其核心是使用 ORB (Orinted FAST and BRIEF) 作为整个视觉 SLAM 中的核心特征。
ORB-SLAM 它是由三大块、三个流程同时运行的：第一块是跟踪，第二块是建图，第三块是闭环检测。
优点：采用 g2o 作为后端优化工具，能有效地减少对特征点位置和自身位姿的估计误差；采用 DBOW 减少了寻找特征的计算量，同时回环匹配和重定位效果较好；使用了类似「适者生存」的方案来进行关键帧的删选，提高系统追踪的鲁棒性和系统的可持续运行。
缺点：构建出的地图是稀疏点云图，即只保留了图像中特征点的一部分作为关键点，固定在空间中进行定位，很难描绘地图中的障碍物的存在；初始化时最好保持低速运动，对准特征和几何纹理丰富的物体；旋转时比较容易丢帧，特别是对于纯旋转，对噪声敏感，不具备尺度不变性；如果使用纯视觉 slam 用于机器人导航，可能会精度不高，或者产生累积误差、漂移
